questions.question: My brother ………………………. a nice watch.
questions.description: The subject brother is a singular noun and hence we use has.

questions.question: My parents …………………….. bought a house in the countryside.
questions.description: The subject parents is a plural noun and hence we use have.

questions.question: I …………………….. nothing to say.
questions.description: The first person singular pronoun 'I' takes the verb have.

questions.question: You ……………………… always been a great help.
questions.description: Both the singular and the plural form of the second person you take the verb have.

questions.question: What ……………………… you done?
questions.description: Both the singular and the plural form of the second person you take the verb have.

questions.question: He ………………….. no idea what he is doing.
questions.description: The third person singular he takes has.

questions.question: They …………………… agreed to come.
questions.description: The third person plural pronoun they takes have.

questions.question: The puppy ……………………….. had its breakfast.
questions.description: Puppy is a singular noun and hence it takes has.

questions.question: The students ……………………….. rehearsed well.
questions.description: Students is a plural noun and hence it takes have.

questions.question: Sonia …………………… a lovely voice.
questions.description: Sonia is a singular noun and hence it takes has.

questions.question: My brothers ……………………….. decided to go camping.
The baby ……………………… been sleeping since morning.
